selected_quotes: Study of the effect of surface coating on the upconversion of #lanthanide doped #nanoparticles

citation.abstract: Surface coating is a commonly used strategy to enhance upconversion emissions by shielding the luminescent core from surface quenching. In this work, we provide insights into the effect of surface coating on upconversion enhancement by comparatively investigating NaYF4:Yb/Er nanoparticles and the corresponding NaYF4:Yb/Er@NaYF4 core-shell nanoparticles as a function of dopant concentration of Yb3+ and excitation power. We observe a declining emission enhancement factors with decreasing the Yb3+ concentration and increasing the excitation power. Our mechanistic investigations suggest that the phenomenon originates from the stepwise excitation in the upconversion process as well as energy hopping among the Yb3+ dopants. The advances in understanding the effect of surface coating on upconversion should be an important step towards the rational design of lanthanide-doped core-shell nanoparticles for various applications.
